snippet: The country should welcome innovative health devices but should also pass legislation to protect individual privacy.
abstract: Editorial warns that most of the medical and personal information collected by Apple's new smartwatch and similar devices is not protected by federal privacy laws; contends while Apple is taking admirable steps to shore up privacy, no amount of caution can take the place of strong privacy laws that give consumers control over how data companies collect their information, and to whom it is sold.
lead_paragraph: The country should welcome innovative health devices but should also pass legislation to protect individual privacy.
